title: Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Early Warning System," Front Side", ca. 1987
medium: Black marking pen, brush and watercolor/gouache (?), yellow, white, turquoise pastel/crayon (?); graphite on white tracing paper
description: Three panel screen on wheels with left and center panels forming a square, painted with blue and black checks. On top of central panel is green target.  Intersecting left panel from upper left is a yellow lightning bolt and intersecting central panel from right is an orange triangle, with sketch of face on it,  on vertical support.  On central panel, between lightning and orange triangle, is rough sketch of rocket sitting on horizontal white line.  Under black checks segments of maps are visible.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Early Warning System," Front Side", ca. 1987. Black marking pen, brush and watercolor/gouache (?), yellow, white, turquoise pastel/crayon (?); graphite on white tracing paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-101.
